2. He won his 4,000th race riding Mountain Tunes to victory at Towcester on 7 November 2013.
3. McCoy won multiple Champion Jockey titles and achieved significant milestones in his career, such as surpassing records for the most wins in a season and becoming the first jump jockey to ride 2,500 winners.

Advanced information:
1. McCoy won the Conditional Jump Jockeys Title in his first season riding in Britain, with a record 74 winners for a conditional jockey.
2. He rode his 3,000th winner at Santa Anita Park on April 7, 2005, and his 3000th winner at Plumpton on the Nicky Henderson trained Restless D'Artaix in the Tyser & Co Beginners' Chase on 9 February 2009.
3. McCoy won the Grand National in 2010 aboard Don't Push It and was named BBC Sports Personality of the Year in the same year.
